00043 /**
00044  *  Utility function for returning subset values to place in whole sample list
00045  *
00046  * @param Target - destination for values
00047  * @param src - values defined for subset
00048  * @param subset - definition of subset of samples
00049  */
00050 template <typename T1>
00051 void t_place_subset(vector<T1> &Target, vector<T1> &src, vector<int> &subset)
00052 {
00053   int ti,i;
00054   ti=0;
00055   for (i=0; i<subset.size(); i++)
00056   if (subset[i]>0) {
00057     Target[i] = src[ti];
00058     ti++;
00059   }
00060 }
00061 
00062 /**
00063  *  Utility function to grab a set of samples (like male/female)
00064  *
00065  * @param target - destination for values
00066  * @param source - values defined for subset
00067  * @param subset - definition of subset of samples
00068  */
00069 template <typename T1>
00070 void t_extract_subset(std::vector<T1> &target, std::vector<T1> &source, std::vector<int> &subset)
00071 {
00072   int i,ti;
00073 
00074   ti=0;
00075   for (i=0; i<source.size(); i++) {
00076     if (subset[i]>0) {
00077       target[ti] = source[i];
00078       ti++;
00079     }
00080   }
00081 }

00086 
00087 QuantLabelZ::QuantLabelZ(enum Transformation transform,
00088                          double K,
00089                          bool lowPrecision) 
00090 {
00091   if (transform > CCS || transform < MvA) {
00092     Err::errAbort("QuantLabelZ() - Expecting transform to be between: " + ToStr(MvA) + " (MvA) and: " + 
00093                   ToStr(CCS) + " (CCS), but got: " + ToStr(transform));
00094   }
00095   m_bCopyNumber = false;
00096   m_Param.m_LowPrecision = lowPrecision;
00097   m_Param.m_Transform = transform;
00098   m_Param.m_K = K;
00099   em_thresh = 0.05;
00100   em_cutoff = 0.5;
00101   gender_cutoff = 0.1;
00102   m_QuantMethod = NULL;
00103   m_SelectionOverride = 0; // do not override values for selection
00104   sp.Initialize();
00105   m_KnownGenoTypes = NULL;
00106   m_SnpPosteriorTsv_ver=-1;
00107   m_ProbeSetsToReport = NULL;
00108   m_ZWGenderCalling = false;
00109 
00110   setupSelfDoc(*this);
00111   setOptValue("transform", stringForTransformation(m_Param.m_Transform));
00112   setOptValue("K", ToStr(m_Param.m_K));
00113   setOptValue("lowprecision", m_Param.m_LowPrecision);
00114   setOptValue("copynumber", m_bCopyNumber);
00115   // set some bogus filenames for debugging.
00116   m_NormSummaryTsv.setFilename("m_NormSummaryTsv-DEBUG");
00117   m_SnpPosteriorTsv.setFilename("m_SnpPosteriorTsv-DEBUG");
00118 }

00120 /** Destructor. */
00121 QuantLabelZ::~QuantLabelZ()
00122 {
00123   if (m_SequentialModelTsv.is_open()) 
00124     m_SequentialModelTsv.close();
00125   if (m_NormSummaryTsv.is_open())
00126     m_NormSummaryTsv.close();
00127   if (m_SnpPosteriorTsv.is_open())
00128     m_SnpPosteriorTsv.close();
00129   if (m_SnpProbeTsv.is_open())
00130     m_SnpProbeTsv.close();
00131   //
00132   for (std::vector<QuantMethodReport *>::iterator it = m_Reporters.begin(); it != m_Reporters.end(); it++)
00133     {
00134       delete *it;
00135     }
00136   m_Reporters.clear();
00137   m_vectSnpPriors.deleteAll();
00138   if (m_QuantMethod != NULL) {delete m_QuantMethod; m_QuantMethod = NULL;}
00139 }

00141 bool QuantLabelZ::prepare(const IntensityMart &iMart)
00142 {
00143   bool result = true;
00144   for (int i=0; i<m_Reporters.size(); i++)
00145     result = result && m_Reporters[i]->prepare(*this, iMart);
00146 
00147   //
00148   if (!m_SnpPosteriorName.empty()) {
00149     std::vector<std::string>::const_iterator keyIx, paramIx;
00150     //
00151     Verbose::out(1, "Got " + ToStr(m_Info.m_ParamValues.size()) + " headers to write.");
00152     m_SnpPosteriorTsv.addHeader("affymetrix-algorithm-param-probeset_count", ToStr(m_Info.m_NumProbeSets));
00153     for (keyIx = m_Info.m_ParamNames.begin(), paramIx = m_Info.m_ParamValues.begin();
00154         keyIx != m_Info.m_ParamNames.end() && paramIx != m_Info.m_ParamValues.end();
00155         ++keyIx, ++paramIx) {
00156       // @todo should we using the AffymetrixParameterConsts.h #defined values?
00157       m_SnpPosteriorTsv.addHeader("affymetrix-algorithm-param-" + *keyIx, *paramIx);
00158     }
00159     for (keyIx = m_Info.m_ClientInfoNames.begin(), paramIx = m_Info.m_ClientInfoValues.begin();
00160         keyIx != m_Info.m_ClientInfoNames.end() && paramIx != m_Info.m_ClientInfoValues.end();
00161       ++keyIx, ++paramIx) {
00162       // @todo should we using the AffymetrixParameterConsts.h #defined values?
00163       m_SnpPosteriorTsv.addHeader("affymetrix-application-meta-data-info-" + *keyIx, *paramIx);
00164     }
00165     QuantLabelZ__writeSnpPosteriorTsv(m_SnpPosteriorTsv,m_SnpPosteriorName,m_PosteriorFormat,m_SnpPosteriorTsv_ver); 
00166   }
00167   return result;
00168 }
00169 
00170 bool QuantLabelZ::finish() 
00171 {
00172   bool result = true;
00173   m_SnpPosteriorTsv.close();
00174   for (int i=0; i<m_Reporters.size(); i++)
00175     result = result && m_Reporters[i]->finish(*this);
00176   return result;
00177 }

00182   doc.setDocDescription("Do genotyping calls with BRLMM-P (perfect match) algorithm.");

00191   m_BValues.clear();

00200 /**
00201  * Sets up the intensities and summaries for a probe set
00202  * Separate function, because shared between several routines (gender, normalization, labeling)
00203  * Ideally, would be inherited from global genotyping class
00204  *
00205  * @param gtPs - probe set to be set up
00206  * @param layout - probes located on chip
00207  * @param iMart - serves up raw intensities
00208  * @param iTrans - transforms intensities
00209  * @param pmAdjust - background adjust
00210  * @param doReport - throw summaries out to reporters or not
00211  */
00212 bool QuantLabelZ::SetUpProbeSet(const ProbeSet *gtPs,
00213                                 const IntensityMart &iMart, std::vector<ChipStream *> &iTrans,
00214                                 PmAdjuster &pmAdjust, bool doReport){
00215 
00216   bool success=true;
00217 
00218   if (!canSetUpProbeSet(gtPs)) {return false;}
00219   m_ProbesetName = gtPs->name;
00220   m_GtProbeSet = gtPs;
00221   m_AValues.clear();
00222   m_BValues.clear();
00223 
00224   bool report = doReport;
00225   if (m_ProbeSetsToReport != NULL) {
00226     if (m_ProbeSetsToReport->find(m_ProbesetName.c_str())==m_ProbeSetsToReport->end()) {
00227       report = false;
00228     }
00229   }
00230   fillInAlleleProbeSets(*gtPs, m_Aallele, m_Ballele);
00231   // if by some mischance we have failed to specify method
00232   if (m_QuantMethod == NULL) {
00233     QuantMethodFactory factory(QuantMethodFactory::Expression);
00234     string spec = "plier.optmethod=1";
00235     ChipLayout layout;
00236     m_QuantMethod = factory.quantExprMethodForString(spec, layout, QuantMethodFactory::Expression);
00237   }
00238   // load up the data
00239   success &= summarizeAllele(&m_Aallele, m_AValues, iMart, iTrans, pmAdjust, m_QuantMethod, m_Param.m_LowPrecision, report,m_Reporters);
00240   if (gtPs->psType == ProbeSet::Copynumber) {return false;}
00241   if (m_Ballele.atoms.size() < 1) {
00242     return false;
00243   }
00244   success &= summarizeAllele(&m_Ballele, m_BValues, iMart, iTrans, pmAdjust, m_QuantMethod, m_Param.m_LowPrecision, report,m_Reporters);
00245 
00246   // grab probe values if doing probe selection
00247   if (m_SnpProbeTsv.is_open()){
00248     //do this again, because summarizeAllele clears the probeset m_Aallele and m_Ballele
00249     fillInAlleleProbeSets(*gtPs, m_Aallele, m_Ballele);
00250     extractProbes(m_PM_A, &m_Aallele, m_A_probeId, iMart,iTrans,pmAdjust,m_Param.m_LowPrecision,m_QuantMethod);
00251     extractProbes(m_PM_B, &m_Ballele, m_B_probeId, iMart,iTrans,pmAdjust,m_Param.m_LowPrecision,m_QuantMethod);
00252   }
00253 
00254   // transform the data as specified
00255   transform();
00256   loadInitialCallsForSnp(gtPs->name);
00257   if ( m_bProbeSetTrustOpt && m_ProbeSetTrust.empty() ) {
00258     loadProbeSetTrustFromTmpFile();
00259   }
00260   return(success);
00261 }
00262 
00263 /**
00264  * Load up the initial calls for SNP
00265  */
00266 void QuantLabelZ::loadInitialCallsForSnp(const string &probeset) {
00267   // setup hints for genotype
00268   m_InitialCalls.clear();
00269   if (m_KnownGenoTypes != NULL) {
00270     KnownGenoTypes_iter_t mapIter = m_KnownGenoTypes->find(probeset.c_str());
00271     //  std::map<string, vector<affx::GType> >::iterator mapIter = m_KnownGenoTypes.find(gtPs->name);
00272     if (mapIter == m_KnownGenoTypes->end()) {
00273         // unlike BRLMM, this is not >necessary< for analysis
00274         Verbose::out(4,"Did not find known genotype for probeset " + probeset);
00275     }
00276     else{
00277         vector<affx::GType> &gType = mapIter->second;
00278         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < gType.size(); i++) {
00279         m_InitialCalls.push_back(gType[i]);
00280         }
00281     }
00282   }
00283 }
00284 
00285 void QuantLabelZ::loadProbeSetTrustFromTmpFile(){
00286   affx::TsvFile tsv;
00287   std::string chpId;
00288   std::string probesetId;
00289   int trustedCount;
00290   
00291   // Aborts on error. 
00292   if ( tsv.open(m_ProbeSetTrustTmpFileName) != affx::TSV_OK ) {
00293     APT_ERR_ABORT(m_ProbeSetTrustTmpFileName + " file not found or permission denied");
00294   }
00295 
00296   tsv.bind(0, "chp_id", &chpId,   affx::TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00297   tsv.bind(0, "probeset_id", &probesetId,   affx::TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00298   tsv.bind(0, "trust_count", &trustedCount, affx::TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00299 
00300   m_ProbeSetTrust.clear();
00301   
00302   while (tsv.nextLevel(0)==TSV_OK) {
00303     std::string trustKey = chpId + ":" + probesetId;
00304     APT_ERR_ASSERT( m_ProbeSetTrust.count(trustKey) == 0,
00305                     "Invalid artifact reduction trusted probeset file, "
00306                     + m_ProbeSetTrustTmpFileName
00307                     + ", has duplicate id: "
00308                     + trustKey);
00309     
00310     m_ProbeSetTrust[trustKey] = trustedCount;
00311   }
00312 
00313   tsv.close();
00314 }

00316 /**
00317  * SelectGoodProbes selects probe pairs that contribute most to classification
00318  */
00319 void QuantLabelZ::SelectGoodProbes() {
00320   // rescan the data to find the probes that contributed most to the output
00321   // compare genotypes to input data
00322 
00323   // step 1: obtain all the raw probe input data from ExprMethod
00324   // step 1 is actually done in SetUpProbeSet
00325   // step 2: Iterate over all pairs of probes
00326   // step 2a: construct transformed data for each pair of probes
00327   // setp 2b: compute genotyping regression/classification against data
00328   // step 2c: evaluate goodness of this probe pair
00329   // step 3: dump best probe(s) to summary file with evaluation
00330   // step 3a: dump all probes to summary file with evaluation
00331 
00332   vector<double> DummyA, DummyB,Predictor;
00333   vector< vector<double> > Covariate;
00334   vector<int> RealCalls,TmpCalls;
00335   vector<double> Summaries;
00336   double AIC;
00337   unsigned int i,j,k,ValidCallNum;
00338   vector<double> PriorM;
00339   vector<double> PriorW;
00340 
00341   PriorM.resize(3);
00342   PriorW.resize(3);
00343   // use the fitted posterior
00344   PriorM[0] = sp.posterior.aa.m;
00345   PriorM[1] = sp.posterior.ab.m;
00346   PriorM[2] = sp.posterior.bb.m;
00347   PriorW[0]=PriorW[1]=PriorW[2] = 0.01; // 1 percent data point if no obs
00348 
00349   RealCalls.resize(m_Calls.size());
00350   for (i=0; i<RealCalls.size(); i++) {
00351      // make sure this is "int" worthy and 0-2 range
00352       RealCalls[i] = affx::GType_to_int(m_Calls[i]);
00353    }
00354   for (i=0; i<m_InitialCalls.size(); i++) {
00355       if (m_InitialCalls[i]!=affx::NN && m_SelectionOverride)
00356         // make sure this is "int" worthy and 0-2 range
00357         RealCalls[i] = affx::GType_to_int(m_InitialCalls[i]);
00358    }
00359 
00360   // now I have a set of calls, some of which may be nonexistent
00361   // filter the data by valid calls
00362   ValidCallNum=0;
00363   for (i=0; i<RealCalls.size(); i++) {
00364     if (RealCalls[i]>-1) {
00365         ValidCallNum++;
00366     }
00367   }
00368   if (ValidCallNum < 2) {
00369     Err::errAbort("At least two valid calls are needed for each probeset in order to use --select-probes.  Probeset " + m_ProbesetName + " has one or zero valid calls.");
00370   }
00371   TmpCalls.resize(ValidCallNum); // how many calls Valid
00372   k=0;
00373   for (i=0; i<RealCalls.size(); i++)
00374     if (RealCalls[i]>-1){
00375         TmpCalls[k] = RealCalls[i];
00376         k++;
00377     }
00378 
00379   DummyA.resize(ValidCallNum);
00380   DummyB.resize(ValidCallNum);
00381 
00382   // loop over all probes
00383   for (j=0; j<m_PM_A.size() && (ValidCallNum>0); j++) {
00384     k=0;
00385     for (i=0; i<m_PM_A[j].size(); i++) {
00386         // filter the data by valid calls
00387         if (RealCalls[i]>-1) {
00388             DummyA[k] = m_PM_A[j][i];
00389             DummyB[k] = m_PM_B[j][i];
00390             k++;
00391         }
00392     }
00393     GenoUtility_transformData(DummyA, DummyB, m_Param.m_Transform,m_Param.m_K);
00394     Covariate.clear();
00395     //
00396     // take out 'no calls'
00397     Covariate.push_back(DummyA);
00398     Summaries.clear();
00399     //cout << endl;
00400     //cout << m_ProbesetName << "\t"; // dummy test
00401     AIC = LogisticRegression(Summaries,Predictor,TmpCalls,Covariate,PriorM,PriorW,100,.001);
00402 
00403     writeSnpProbeValue(m_SnpProbeTsv,j,m_A_probeId[j],m_B_probeId[j],
00404                         Summaries,Predictor,Predictor,m_ProbesetName);
00405   }
00406 }

00408 /*
00409  * @brief normalizes the data or other modifications
00410  */
00411 void QuantLabelZ::PreprocessValues() {
00412   // transform data, do any normalization
00413   // transform the data
00414   // transform()
00415   // generate calls for tranformed data
00416 
00417   // here, we apply normalization prediction across everything
00418 
00419   // AValues = Contrast
00420   // BValues = Strength
00421   vector<double> Cov; // to be covariates, offset/cubed as required
00422   double tmpf, strength, contrast;
00423   unsigned int sIx; // sample iterator
00424   for (sIx=0; sIx<normMap.size(); sIx++) {
00425     // isolate this, because not all transforms alike
00426     strength = m_BValues[sIx];
00427     contrast = m_AValues[sIx];
00428     // make offset/cubed covariates
00429     normMap[sIx].MakeCov(Cov,strength);
00430     // generate prediction
00431     tmpf = normMap[sIx].MakePrediction(contrast,Cov);
00432     // place back in appropriate register
00433     m_AValues[sIx]=tmpf;
00434   }
00435 
00436   // write out processed values
00437   if (m_NormSummaryTsv.is_open()) {
00438     writeNormSummaryValue(m_ProbesetName,m_AValues,m_BValues);
00439   }
00440 
00441 }

00443 void QuantLabelZ::EliminateUntrustedSamples(vector<int> & SnpSampleCopyNumber){
00444   // remove any sample who doesn't have trustworthy probes
00445   // by setting "copynumber" =0 in such cases
00446   for (int sIx=0; sIx<m_AValues.size(); sIx++){
00447     if (!isTrusted(sIx)){
00448       SnpSampleCopyNumber[sIx]=0;
00449     }
00450   }
00451 }
00452 
00453 // just checks to see if this sample has any trusted probes
00454 bool QuantLabelZ::isTrusted(int cIx){
00455   if ( m_ProbeSetTrust.empty() ) {
00456     return true;
00457   }
00458   map<string,int>::iterator iter;
00459   bool retval=true;  // return trusted if not found
00460   
00461   // only get zero block for testing
00462   std::string trustKey = ToStr(cIx)+":"+m_ProbesetName; 
00463   iter = m_ProbeSetTrust.find(trustKey);
00464   if (iter!=m_ProbeSetTrust.end() &&  (iter->second<1) ) {
00465     retval=false;
00466   }
00467   return(retval);
00468 }

00516 
00517 void QuantLabelZ::getSequentialPrior(std::string &name, snp_param &tsp, snp_labeled_distribution &sDist) {
00518   if (m_SequentialModelTsv.nextLevel(0) == affx::TSV_OK) {
00519     QuantLabelZ__SnpPriorFromStrings(sDist, m_BB, m_AB, m_AA, m_CV);
00520     sDist.probeset_id = m_Id;
00521     tsp.prior.Copy(sDist.Dist);
00522     if (name != m_Id) {
00523       APT_ERR_ABORT("Expecting: " + name + " but got: " + m_Id);
00524     }
00525   }
00526   else {
00527     APT_ERR_ABORT("Expecting model for snp: " + name);
00528   }
00529 }
00530 
00531 void QuantLabelZ::getPrior(std::string &TmpName, int presentCopyNumber, snp_param &tsp, snp_labeled_distribution &sDist) {
00532   if (m_SequentialModelTsv.is_open()) {
00533     getSequentialPrior(TmpName, tsp, sDist);
00534   }
00535   else if (m_vectSnpPriors.getCount() > 0) {
00536     snp_labeled_distribution objSearch;
00537     snp_labeled_distribution* p=NULL; 
00538     objSearch.probeset_id = TmpName;
00539     int iSearchIndex = m_vectSnpPriors.binarySearch(objSearch, 0);
00540     if (iSearchIndex == -1){
00541       if (presentCopyNumber<2){
00542         objSearch.probeset_id = "GENERIC:" + ToStr(presentCopyNumber);
00543       } else {
00544         objSearch.probeset_id = "GENERIC";
00545       }
00546       iSearchIndex = m_vectSnpPriors.binarySearch(objSearch,0);
00547     } 
00548     if (iSearchIndex==-1) {
00549       // should this fail to global prior?
00550       Err::errAbort("Can't find model for SNP: " + TmpName);
00551     } else {
00552       p = m_vectSnpPriors.getAt(iSearchIndex);
00553       sDist = *p;
00554       // this is really one copy operation!!!
00555       tsp.prior.Copy(p->Dist);
00556       /*
00557         tsp.prior.aa = p->Dist.aa;
00558         tsp.prior.ab = p->Dist.ab;
00559         tsp.prior.bb = p->Dist.bb;
00560         tsp.prior.xah = p->Dist.xah;
00561         tsp.prior.xab = p->Dist.xab;
00562         tsp.prior.xhb = p->Dist.xhb;
00563         tsp.prior.yah = p->Dist.yah;
00564         tsp.prior.yab = p->Dist.yab;
00565         tsp.prior.yhb = p->Dist.yhb;
00566         tsp.prior.xyah = p->Dist.xyah;
00567         tsp.prior.xyab = p->Dist.xyab;
00568         tsp.prior.xyhb = p->Dist.xyhb;
00569         tsp.prior.yxah = p->Dist.yxah;
00570         tsp.prior.yxab = p->Dist.yxab;
00571         tsp.prior.yxhb = p->Dist.yxhb;
00572       */
00573     }
00574   }
00575 }
00576 
00577 std::string QuantLabelZ::getCallProbabilities(int idx) {
00578   return ToStr(m_Txb[idx])+","+ToStr(m_Txh[idx])+","+ToStr(m_Txa[idx])+","+ToStr(1 - m_Txb[idx] - m_Txh[idx] - m_Txa[idx]);
00579 }
00580 
00581 void QuantLabelZ::SubsetSetup(vector<int> &samplesubset, int &subsetlength, int copyIx, vector<int>& SnpSampleCopyNumber) {
00582   int sIx;
00583 
00584    for (sIx=0; sIx<samplesubset.size(); sIx++) {
00585       //logic
00586       if (SnpSampleCopyNumber[sIx]==copyIx)
00587         samplesubset[sIx]=1;
00588       else
00589         samplesubset[sIx]=0;
00590     }
00591 
00592     // setup input data
00593     subsetlength = 0;
00594     for (int i=0; i<samplesubset.size(); i++)
00595       subsetlength += samplesubset[i];
00596 }
00597 
00598 /**
00599  * @brief Do the heavy lifting of estimation.
00600  */
00601 void QuantLabelZ::computeEstimate() {
00602 
00603 
00604   static int call_count = 0;
00605   call_count++;
00606   
00607   snp_labeled_distribution objSearch;
00608   // first, do anything necessary
00609   PreprocessValues();
00610 
00611   vector<affx::GType> tcall;
00612   vector<double> tconf, tx, ty;
00613   vector<double> txa, txh, txb;
00614 
00615   // set up snp specific prior if available
00616   snp_param tsp;
00617 
00618   // numeric method does its magic here
00619   // call the numerics
00620   int length;
00621   length = m_AValues.size();
00622   m_Calls.assign(length,affx::NN);
00623   m_Confidences.assign(length,0);
00624   if (m_OutputProbabilities) {
00625     m_Txa.assign(length, 0);
00626     m_Txh.assign(length, 0);
00627     m_Txb.assign(length, 0);
00628   }
00629 
00630   // standardized distance to each cluster
00631   m_Distances.resize(3);
00632   for (int m_Di=0; m_Di<3; m_Di++)
00633     m_Distances[m_Di].assign(length,0);
00634 
00635   vector<int> samplesubset;
00636   vector<int> GenoHint, GenoRef;
00637   vector<double> SubsetInbredPenalty; 
00638   
00639   samplesubset.assign(length,1);
00640   int subsetlength;
00641   int copyIx,sIx;
00642   string TmpName;
00643 
00644   // put together the reference vector of seeds, if it exists
00645   GenoRef.assign(length,affx::NN);
00646   for (unsigned int qIx=0; qIx<m_InitialCalls.size(); qIx++)
00647     GenoRef[qIx] = affx::GType_to_int(m_InitialCalls[qIx]);
00648 
00649   // look up the right copy number for this snp
00650   int MaleCopy,FemaleCopy;
00651   map<string,pair<int, int> >::iterator test;
00652   test=m_SpecialSnps.find(m_ProbesetName);
00653   if (test==m_SpecialSnps.end()) {
00654     MaleCopy=2;
00655     FemaleCopy=2;
00656   }
00657   else {
00658     MaleCopy=test->second.first;
00659     FemaleCopy=test->second.second;
00660   }
00661 
00662   // assign sample copy numbers for this snp
00663   vector<int> SnpSampleCopyNumber;
00664   SnpSampleCopyNumber.assign(length,2); // default for all regular snps
00665   for (sIx=0; sIx<length; sIx++) {
00666     if (m_Genders[sIx] == affx::Female)
00667       SnpSampleCopyNumber[sIx] = FemaleCopy;
00668     else if (m_Genders[sIx] == affx::Male)
00669       SnpSampleCopyNumber[sIx] = MaleCopy;
00670     else if (m_Genders[sIx] == affx::UnknownGender) {
00671       if (m_ZWGenderCalling) {
00672         SnpSampleCopyNumber[sIx] = MaleCopy;
00673       }
00674       else {
00675         SnpSampleCopyNumber[sIx] = FemaleCopy;
00676       }
00677     }
00678     else
00679       Err::errAbort("Unknown gender seen by genotype caller: " + ToStr(m_Genders[sIx]));
00680   }
00681 
00682   map<string,vector<int> >::iterator test2;
00683   test2=m_SpecialSampleSnps.find(m_ProbesetName);
00684   if (test2!=m_SpecialSampleSnps.end()) {
00685     for (sIx=0; sIx<length; sIx++) {
00686       SnpSampleCopyNumber[sIx] = test2->second[sIx];
00687     }
00688   }
00689 
00690   if (m_bProbeSetTrustOpt)
00691     EliminateUntrustedSamples(SnpSampleCopyNumber);
00692 
00693   // Do subsets by copy number
00694   for (copyIx=2; copyIx>0; copyIx--) {
00695     
00696     // assign appropriate subset to current copy number
00697     SubsetSetup(samplesubset,subsetlength, copyIx, SnpSampleCopyNumber);
00698 
00699     // if there's anything to do
00700     if (subsetlength>0) {
00701       // if there's something to do, find the SNP specific prior
00702 
00703       tsp.copy(sp); // duplicate current parameters to keep commands
00704       tsp.copynumber=copyIx; // what copy for this snp so know right model centers
00705 
00706       // look up this snp and/or prepare for output
00707       TmpName = m_ProbesetName;
00708       if (copyIx<2)
00709         TmpName = m_ProbesetName + ":" +ToStr(copyIx);
00710           // if any to look up
00711       snp_labeled_distribution sDist;
00712       if (m_vectSnpPriors.getCount() > 0 || m_SequentialModelTsv.is_open()) {
00713         getPrior(TmpName, copyIx, tsp, sDist);
00714       }
00715 
00716       tcall.resize(subsetlength);
00717       tconf.resize(subsetlength);
00718       tx.resize(subsetlength);
00719       ty.resize(subsetlength);
00720       GenoHint.assign(subsetlength,-1);
00721       SubsetInbredPenalty.assign(subsetlength,0); // Null penalty
00722 
00723       t_extract_subset(tx,m_AValues,samplesubset);
00724       t_extract_subset(ty,m_BValues,samplesubset);
00725       t_extract_subset(GenoHint,GenoRef,samplesubset);
00726       t_extract_subset(SubsetInbredPenalty,m_InbredHetPenalty,samplesubset);
00727       // am I getting anything useful here
00728      
00729       // note: using temporary copy of main parameters tsp
00730       bayes_label(tcall,tconf,tx,ty,GenoHint,SubsetInbredPenalty,tsp,txa,txh,txb,m_OutputProbabilities);
00731 
00732       // transfer data to calls
00733       t_place_subset(m_Calls,tcall,samplesubset);
00734       t_place_subset(m_Confidences,tconf,samplesubset);
00735       if (m_OutputProbabilities) {
00736         t_place_subset(m_Txa,txa,samplesubset);
00737         t_place_subset(m_Txh,txh,samplesubset);
00738         t_place_subset(m_Txb,txb,samplesubset);
00739       }
00740 
00741       // note: bayes_label uses probability, not distance
00742       // computing standardized distance to be compatible QC
00743 
00744       vector<double> tsd;
00745       int tsdi;
00746       tsd.assign(subsetlength,0);
00747       for (tsdi=0; tsdi<subsetlength; tsdi++) {
00748         tsd[tsdi] = abs((tsp.posterior.aa.m-tx[tsdi])/sqrt(tsp.posterior.aa.ss));
00749       }
00750       t_place_subset(m_Distances[0],tsd,samplesubset);
00751       for (tsdi=0; tsdi<subsetlength; tsdi++) {
00752         tsd[tsdi] = abs((tsp.posterior.ab.m-tx[tsdi])/sqrt(tsp.posterior.ab.ss));
00753       }
00754       t_place_subset(m_Distances[1],tsd,samplesubset);
00755       for (tsdi=0; tsdi<subsetlength; tsdi++) {
00756         tsd[tsdi] = abs((tsp.posterior.bb.m-tx[tsdi])/sqrt(tsp.posterior.bb.ss));
00757       }
00758       t_place_subset(m_Distances[2],tsd,samplesubset);
00759 
00760       // now possible output of snp-specific posterior
00761       // that is, now we've updated the prior with the data
00762       // and we want to save what we learned
00763       if (m_SnpPosteriorTsv.is_open()) {
00764         writeSnpPosteriorValue(TmpName, tsp);
00765       }
00766 
00767     } // done processing this copy number
00768   } // back into the loop for more copy number tries
00769 
00770   // made calls for all samples
00771   // select probe that best mimics
00772   // hack: chrX not yet handled differently
00773   // but should work in regression framework?
00774 
00775   if (m_SnpProbeTsv.is_open()){
00776     SelectGoodProbes();
00777   }
00778   
00779 }
00780 
00781 /**
00782  * @brief Set up the quantification method given all the data about the probe
00783  * set, chip layout and data.
00784  *
00785  * @param psGroup - Probes to be used for final estimate.
00786  * @param layout - Chip layout annotation.
00787  * @param iMart - Raw data from chips.
00788  * @param iTrans - Transformations to be applied to data before use.
00789  * @param pmAdjust - How to estimate background, or MM probe.
00790  * @return True if setup sucessful, false otherwise.
00791  */
00792 bool QuantLabelZ::setUp(ProbeSetGroup &psGroup, const IntensityMart &iMart, 
00793                         std::vector<ChipStream *> &iTrans, PmAdjuster &pmAdjust) {
00794         const ProbeSet *gtPs = NULL; //         Genotyping probeset
00795   blankSelf(); // Make sure we clear out the past analysis before starting this one.
00796   bool success = true;
00797   /* Sanity checks about probesets. */
00798   if (psGroup.probeSets.empty())
00799     Err::errAbort("Zero probesets in ProbeSetGroup (group: " + ToStr(psGroup.name) + ").");
00800   if (psGroup.probeSets.size() > 1)
00801     Err::errAbort("Can't have multiple probesets in a genotyping ProbeSetGroup (group: " + ToStr(psGroup.name) + ").");
00802 
00803   /* Remember this probeset. */
00804   gtPs = psGroup.probeSets[0];
00805   success &= SetUpProbeSet(gtPs, iMart,iTrans,pmAdjust, true);
00806   if (!success)
00807     blankSelf();
00808   return success;
00809 }
00810 
00811 /**
00812  * Construct a contrast normalization function from a collection of probesets. *
00813  * @param probeSets - ProbeSets to be used in computing normalizer.
00814  * @param layout - description and chip and probesets.
00815  * @param iMart - Cel file data for probesets.
00816  * @param iTrans - Transformers to operate on raw data (i.e. normalization and bg subtraction).
00817  * @param pmAdjust - Individual probe adjustment like pm-mm or pm-only.
00818  *
00819  * @return - returns a normalization function set.
00820  */
00821 vector<NormalizationPredictor> QuantLabelZ::makeNorm(std::vector<std::string> probeSets, ChipLayout &layout,
00822                                    const IntensityMart &iMart, std::vector<ChipStream *> &iTrans,
00823                                    PmAdjuster &pmAdjust) {
00824   //normMap Qmap;
00825   vector<vector<double> > SampleContrast;
00826   vector<vector<double> > SampleStrength;
00827   bool success=true;
00828   unsigned int i;
00829   unsigned int nSample; // how do I detect this again?
00830   nSample=0;
00831 
00832   Verbose::out(1,"making normalization map");
00833   if (probeSets.empty()) {
00834      Err::errAbort("bogus snp sample");
00835   }
00836 
00837   // for each probeset in my sample
00838   for (unsigned int psIx = 0; psIx < probeSets.size(); psIx++) {
00839     // Have to skip probesets that don't have 2 or 4 groups as it
00840     // appears that some are mislabelled in the cdf file.
00841     ProbeListPacked pList = layout.getProbeListByName(probeSets[psIx]);
00842     ///@todo deal with missing probes from kill list
00843     if (pList.isNull()) {
00844       Err::errAbort("QuantLabelZ::makeNorm(): Cannot deal with missing probes from kill list");
00845     }
00846     ProbeSet *gtPs = ProbeListFactory::asProbeSet(pList);
00847     success = SetUpProbeSet(gtPs, iMart,iTrans,pmAdjust, false);
00848     if (!success) {
00849       delete gtPs;
00850       continue;
00851     }
00852     // add snpStats values
00853     // currently contrast/strength
00854     // push into the slots by sample
00855     // set up the slots to put everything in
00856     if (nSample<1) {
00857       nSample=m_AValues.size();
00858       SampleContrast.resize(nSample);
00859       SampleStrength.resize(nSample);
00860     }
00861     for (i=0; i<nSample; i++) {
00862       SampleContrast[i].push_back(m_AValues[i]);
00863       SampleStrength[i].push_back(m_BValues[i]);
00864     }
00865     // look up parameters
00866     //cout << "SNP:\t" << psIx << endl;
00867     delete gtPs;
00868   }
00869   NormalizationFrame TmpFrame;
00870   vector<NormalizationPredictor> Qmap;
00871   Qmap.resize(nSample);
00872   for (i=0; i<nSample; i++) {
00873     // for each sample
00874     TmpFrame.FillInContrast(SampleContrast[i]);
00875     TmpFrame.FillInCovariates(SampleStrength[i]);
00876     TmpFrame.FitEM();
00877     //store in Qmap
00878     Qmap[i].Copy(TmpFrame.ThisFit);
00879     /*cout << "Sample:\t" << i << endl;
00880     td(Qmap[i].fitAA);
00881     td(Qmap[i].fitAB);
00882     td(Qmap[i].fitBB);
00883     td(Qmap[i].sigma);*/
00884   }
00885   // compute normalization function here
00886   // fun for the whole family
00887   return Qmap;
00888 }
00889 
00890 /**
00891  * Calls gender using EM.
00892  * This should not be anywhere near LabelZ, but code structure & time make this easiest.
00893  *
00894  * @param contrast - list of contrast values for chrX snps in one sample
00895  * @param em_thresh -  when are we done?
00896  * @param em_cutoff - enough data to make decision?
00897  * @param gender_cutoff - make decision as to gender
00898  */
00899 Gender t_CallEMGender(const std::vector<double>& contrast,
00900                       double& em_thresh,
00901                       double& em_cutoff,
00902                       double& gender_cutoff) {
00903   Gender retval;
00904   CEMSeed seed;
00905   seed.setMu(-0.66, 0, 0.66);
00906   seed.setSigma(0.1f, 0.1f, 0.1f);
00907   seed.setWeight(0.33f, 0.34f, 0.33f);
00908   seed.setMinMu(-2, -.05, .25);
00909   seed.setMinSigma(0.02f, 0.02f, 0.02f);
00910   seed.setMaxMu(-.25, .05, 2);
00911   seed.setMaxSigma(.3, .3, .3);
00912 
00913   CPrimeEM em;
00914   em.setData(contrast);
00915   em.setThreshold(em_thresh);
00916   em.EMEstimate(seed);
00917   CEMEst* pEst = em.getEMEstimates();
00918   //int nNC = count_if (pEst->m_class.begin(),pEst->m_class.end(),bind2nd(equal_to<int>(),-1));
00919   int nAA = count_if (pEst->m_class.begin(),pEst->m_class.end(),bind2nd(equal_to<int>(),0));
00920   int nBB = count_if (pEst->m_class.begin(),pEst->m_class.end(),bind2nd(equal_to<int>(),2));
00921   int nAB = count_if (pEst->m_class.begin(),pEst->m_class.end(),bind2nd(equal_to<int>(),1));
00922   double HCR=-1;
00923   if (nAA+nBB+nBB > 0 && double(nAA+nAB+nBB)/pEst->m_class.size() > em_cutoff) {
00924       HCR = double(nAB)/double(nAA+nAB+nBB);
00925       if (HCR < gender_cutoff)
00926         retval = affx::Male; // male
00927       else
00928         retval = affx::Female; // female
00929   }
00930   else
00931     retval = affx::UnknownGender; // unknown
00932   return retval;
00933 }
00934 
00935 /**
00936  * Find genders of sample - uses EM, not labeling as you might think!
00937  * Again, this function would be elsewhere if we had a good structure
00938  *
00939  * @param genders - to be determined - what are the genders of the sample
00940  * @param probeSets - use these snps to find genders
00941  * @param layout - where are probes on array
00942  * @param iMart - serve up raw intensities
00943  * @param iTrans - adjust intensities (normalize, etc)
00944  * @param pmAdjust - adjust intensities for background
00945  */
00946 void QuantLabelZ::FindGender(std::vector<affx::Gender> &genders,
00947                              std::vector<ProbeSet *> probeSets,
00948                              ChipLayout &layout,
00949                              const IntensityMart &iMart,
00950                              std::vector<ChipStream *> &iTrans,
00951                              PmAdjuster &pmAdjust) {
00952 
00953   // probeSets contains X-chromosome snps
00954   // so we're going to grab all the summary values
00955   // and call some genders
00956   vector<vector<double> > SampleContrast;
00957   // dead code?
00958   //vector<vector<double> > SampleStrength;
00959   bool success=true;
00960   unsigned int i;
00961   unsigned int nSample; // how do I detect this again?
00962   nSample=0;
00963 
00964   //cout << "Preparing to call gender" << endl;
00965   if (!probeSets[0]) {
00966     Err::errAbort("bogus snp sample");
00967   }
00968 
00969   // for each probeset in my sample
00970   for (unsigned int psIx = 0; psIx < probeSets.size(); psIx++) {
00971     const ProbeSet *gtPs = probeSets[psIx];
00972     // Have to skip probesets that don't have 2 or 4 groups as it
00973     // appears that some are mislabelled in the cdf file.
00974 
00975     success = SetUpProbeSet(gtPs, iMart,iTrans,pmAdjust, false);
00976     if (!success)
00977       continue;
00978     // add snpStats values
00979     // currently contrast/strength
00980     // push into the slots by sample
00981     // set up the slots to put everything in
00982     //cout << "Set up pset: " << psIx << endl;
00983     if (nSample<1) {
00984       nSample=m_AValues.size();
00985       SampleContrast.resize(nSample);
00986       // dead code?
00987       // SampleStrength.resize(nSample);
00988     }
00989     for (i=0; i<nSample; i++) {
00990       SampleContrast[i].push_back(m_AValues[i]);
00991       // dead code? -jhg
00992       //SampleStrength[i].push_back(m_BValues[i]);
00993     }
00994   }
00995 
00996   // same here as normalization, now call gender
00997   // okay have setup the big matrix of contrasts
00998   // for each sample, call the gender
00999   //cout << "setup contrast: call gender " << nSample << "\t" << genders.size() << endl;
01000   std::vector<affx::Gender> Gmap;
01001   Gmap.resize(nSample);
01002   for (i=0; i<nSample; i++) {
01003     if (true) {
01004       Gmap[i] = t_CallEMGender(SampleContrast[i],em_thresh,em_cutoff,gender_cutoff);
01005       //cout << i << "\t"<< Gmap[i] << "\t" << genders[i] << endl;
01006       genders[i] = Gmap[i];
01007     }
01008   }
01009   //cout << endl;
01010   //return Gmap;
01011 }

01015 /**
01016  * @brief Default Getter method for parameters and their documentation.
01017  * @return map of parameters and their descriptions.
01018  */
01019 std::vector<SelfDoc::Opt> QuantLabelZ::getDefaultDocOptions() {
01020   std::vector<SelfDoc::Opt> opts;
01021 
01022   SelfDoc::Opt k = {"K", SelfDoc::Opt::Double, "4.0", "4.0", "0", "NA",
01023                     "Scale parameter used used in CCS and CES transformations."};
01024   opts.push_back(k);
01025   SelfDoc::Opt transform = {"transform", SelfDoc::Opt::String, "CCS", "CCS", "NA", "NA",
01026                             "Transformation of initial data are we feeding into the classifier? {'CCS', 'CES', 'MvA','RvT'}"};
01027   opts.push_back(transform);
01028   SelfDoc::Opt lowprecision = {"lowprecision", SelfDoc::Opt::Boolean, "false", "false", "NA", "NA",
01029                                "R prototype uses summary values rounded to first decimal place. Use this flag to be simulate behavior."};
01030   opts.push_back(lowprecision);
01031 
01032   SelfDoc::Opt kx = {"KX",SelfDoc::Opt::Float,"4.0","4.0","0.0001","NA",
01033                      "Prior strength for Homs"};
01034   opts.push_back(kx);
01035   SelfDoc::Opt kh = {"KH",SelfDoc::Opt::Float,"0.2","0.2","0.0001","NA",
01036                      "Prior strength for Hets"};
01037   opts.push_back(kh);
01038 
01039   SelfDoc::Opt v = {"V",SelfDoc::Opt::Float,"10","10","0.0001","NA",
01040                     "Prior strength for variances"};
01041   opts.push_back(v);
01042 
01043   SelfDoc::Opt aam = {"AAM",SelfDoc::Opt::Float,"0.66","0.66","NA","NA",
01044                       "Prior location of AA mean"};
01045   opts.push_back(aam);
01046   SelfDoc::Opt abm = {"ABM",SelfDoc::Opt::Float,"0","0","NA","NA",
01047                       "Prior location of AB mean"};
01048   opts.push_back(abm);
01049   SelfDoc::Opt bbm = {"BBM",SelfDoc::Opt::Float,"-.66","-.66","NA","NA",
01050                       "Prior location of BB mean"};
01051   opts.push_back(bbm);
01052   SelfDoc::Opt bby = {"BBY",SelfDoc::Opt::Float,"10.0","10.0","NA","NA",
01053                       "Prior location of BB Y mean"};
01054   opts.push_back(bby);
01055   SelfDoc::Opt aby = {"ABY",SelfDoc::Opt::Float,"10.0","10.0","NA","NA",
01056                       "Prior location of AB Y mean"};
01057   opts.push_back(aby);
01058   SelfDoc::Opt aay = {"AAY",SelfDoc::Opt::Float,"10.0","10.0","NA","NA",
01059                       "Prior location of AA Y mean"};
01060   opts.push_back(aay);
01061 
01062   SelfDoc::Opt aav = {"AAV",SelfDoc::Opt::Float,".005",".005","0","NA",
01063                       "Prior variance of AA"};
01064   opts.push_back(aav);
01065   SelfDoc::Opt abv = {"ABV",SelfDoc::Opt::Float,".010",".010","0","NA",
01066                       "Prior variance of AB"};
01067   opts.push_back(abv);
01068   SelfDoc::Opt bbv = {"BBV",SelfDoc::Opt::Float,".005",".005","0","NA",
01069                       "Prior variance of BB"};
01070   opts.push_back(bbv);
01071 
01072   // within cluster variances/covariances
01073  SelfDoc::Opt aayv = {"AAYV",SelfDoc::Opt::Float,"0.1","0.1","0","NA",
01074                       "Prior Variance of AA, Y coordinate"};
01075   opts.push_back(aayv);
01076   SelfDoc::Opt abyv = {"ABYV",SelfDoc::Opt::Float,"0.1","0.1","0","NA",
01077                        "Prior Variance of AB, Y coordinate"};
01078   opts.push_back(abyv);
01079   SelfDoc::Opt bbyv = {"BBYV",SelfDoc::Opt::Float,"0.1","0.1","0","NA",
01080                        "Prior Variance of BB, Y coordinate"};
01081   opts.push_back(bbyv);
01082   // within cluster covariances
01083   SelfDoc::Opt aaxy = {"AAXY",SelfDoc::Opt::Float,"0","0","NA","NA",
01084                        "Prior CoVariance of AA, XY"};
01085   opts.push_back(aaxy);
01086   SelfDoc::Opt abxy = {"ABXY",SelfDoc::Opt::Float,"0","0","NA","NA",
01087                        "Prior CoVariance of AB, XY"};
01088   opts.push_back(abxy);
01089   SelfDoc::Opt bbxy = {"BBXY",SelfDoc::Opt::Float,"0","0","NA","NA",
01090                        "Prior CoVariance of BB, XY "};
01091   opts.push_back(bbxy);
01092 
01093   // between cluster covariances X to X
01094   SelfDoc::Opt kxx = {"KXX", SelfDoc::Opt::Float,"0","0","NA","NA",
01095                       "Prior strength for hom covariance"};
01096   opts.push_back(kxx);
01097   SelfDoc::Opt kah = {"KAH", SelfDoc::Opt::Float,"0","0","NA","NA",
01098                       "Prior strength for A-H covariance"};
01099   opts.push_back(kah);
01100   SelfDoc::Opt khb = {"KHB", SelfDoc::Opt::Float, "0","0", "NA","NA",
01101                       "Prior strength for H-B covariance"};
01102   opts.push_back(khb);
01103   // between cluster covariances Y to Y
01104   SelfDoc::Opt kyah = {"KYAH",SelfDoc::Opt::Float,"0","0","NA","NA",
01105                        "Prior strength for Y-Y A-H cluster"};
01106   opts.push_back(kyah);
01107   SelfDoc::Opt kyab = {"KYAB",SelfDoc::Opt::Float,"0","0","NA","NA",
01108                        "Prior Strength for Y-Y A-B cluster"};
01109   opts.push_back(kyab);
01110   SelfDoc::Opt kyhb = {"KYHB",SelfDoc::Opt::Float,"0","0","NA","NA",
01111                        "Prior Strength for Y-Y H-B cluster"};
01112   opts.push_back(kyhb);
01113 
01114   SelfDoc::Opt comvar = {"COMVAR",SelfDoc::Opt::Integer,"1","1","NA","NA",
01115                          "Flag: common variance"};
01116   opts.push_back(comvar);
01117   SelfDoc::Opt hard = {"HARD",SelfDoc::Opt::Integer,"2","2","NA","NA",
01118                        "Flag: type of hard shell"};
01119   opts.push_back(hard);
01120   SelfDoc::Opt sb   = {"SB",SelfDoc::Opt::Float,".05",".05","0","NA",
01121                        "Size of shell barrier"};
01122   opts.push_back(sb);
01123   SelfDoc::Opt cm   = {"CM",SelfDoc::Opt::Integer,"0","0","NA","NA",
01124                        "Type of call method, CM=1 for posterior, CM=2 for single-sample"};
01125   opts.push_back(cm);
01126   SelfDoc::Opt maxscore = {"MS",SelfDoc::Opt::Float,".2",".2","0","2",
01127                            "Threshold for no-calls"};
01128   opts.push_back(maxscore);
01129   SelfDoc::Opt bins = {"bins",SelfDoc::Opt::Integer,"0","0","NA","NA",
01130                        "Use efficient binning to speed up labeling"};
01131   opts.push_back(bins);
01132   SelfDoc::Opt hints = {"hints",SelfDoc::Opt::Integer,"0","0","NA","NA",
01133                         "Use reference genotype data to indicate clusters"};
01134   opts.push_back(hints);
01135 
01136   SelfDoc::Opt override = {"override",SelfDoc::Opt::Integer,"0","0","NA","NA",
01137                            "Use reference genotype data to select probes"};
01138   opts.push_back(override);
01139 
01140 
01141   SelfDoc::Opt mix = {"mix", SelfDoc::Opt::Integer,"0","0","NA","NA",
01142                       "Apply mixture frequency penalty to clusters"};
01143   opts.push_back(mix);
01144   SelfDoc::Opt bic = {"bic", SelfDoc::Opt::Float, "0","0", "NA","NA",
01145                       "BIC penalty for clusters"};
01146   opts.push_back(bic);
01147 
01148   SelfDoc::Opt CSepPen = {"CSepPen", SelfDoc::Opt::Float, "0","0", "NA","NA",
01149                       "Penalty for ClusterSep/Stdev too small"};
01150   opts.push_back(CSepPen);
01151   SelfDoc::Opt CSepThr = {"CSepThr",SelfDoc::Opt::Float,"16","16","0.000000001","NA",
01152                          "ClusterSep/Stdev threshold discounting by Geman-McClure"};
01153   opts.push_back(CSepThr);
01154 
01155   SelfDoc::Opt IsoHetY = {"IsoHetY",SelfDoc::Opt::Float,"0","0","NA","NA",
01156                                 "Het mean must lie above the line connecting hom means"};
01157   opts.push_back(IsoHetY);
01158 
01159 
01160   SelfDoc::Opt lambda = {"lambda",SelfDoc::Opt::Float,"1","1","0","1",
01161                          "Controls mixing of common variances"};
01162   opts.push_back(lambda);
01163   SelfDoc::Opt wobble = {"wobble",SelfDoc::Opt::Float,".0001",".0001","0","NA",
01164                          "Limits prior pseudo-observations to 1/wobble"};
01165   opts.push_back(wobble);
01166   SelfDoc::Opt copyqc = {"copyqc",SelfDoc::Opt::Float,"0","0","0","1",
01167                          "Test for outlier size values (CNV or errors)"};
01168   opts.push_back(copyqc);
01169   SelfDoc::Opt copytype = {"copytype",SelfDoc::Opt::Integer,"0","0","NA","NA",
01170                            "Flag: Method for handling outlier data points(CNV/errors)"};
01171   opts.push_back(copytype);
01172 
01173   SelfDoc::Opt ocean = {"ocean",SelfDoc::Opt::Float,"0","0","0","1",
01174                         "Test datapoints against uniform ocean probability"};
01175   opts.push_back(ocean);
01176 
01177   SelfDoc::Opt inflatePRA = {"inflatePRA",SelfDoc::Opt::Float,"0","0","0","NA",
01178                              "Make calls adding uncertainty in mean to observed variance"};
01179   opts.push_back(inflatePRA);
01180 
01181   SelfDoc::Opt clustertype = {"clustertype",SelfDoc::Opt::Integer,"1","1","NA","NA",
01182                               "Flag: type of cluster (1-d, etc)"};
01183   opts.push_back(clustertype);
01184 
01185   SelfDoc::Opt cp = {"CP", SelfDoc::Opt::Float,"16","16", "0", "NA",
01186                      "Penalty for contradicting reference genotype"};
01187   opts.push_back(cp);
01188   SelfDoc::Opt hok = {"Hok", SelfDoc::Opt::Integer,"0","0", "NA", "NA",
01189                       "Allow Hints to be flipped in genotype"};
01190   opts.push_back(hok);
01191   SelfDoc::Opt x_em_thresh = {"em_thresh",SelfDoc::Opt::Float,"0.05","0.05","0","NA",
01192                               "set threshold for em gender routine"};
01193   opts.push_back(x_em_thresh);
01194   SelfDoc::Opt x_em_cutoff = {"em_cutoff",SelfDoc::Opt::Float,"0.5","0.5","0","NA",
01195                               "set cutoff for em gender routine"};
01196   opts.push_back(x_em_cutoff);
01197   SelfDoc::Opt x_gender_cutoff = {"gender_cutoff",SelfDoc::Opt::Float,"0.1","0.1","0","NA",
01198                                   "set cutoff for which gender in em gender call"};
01199   opts.push_back(x_gender_cutoff);
01200   SelfDoc::Opt copynumber = {"copynumber",SelfDoc::Opt::Boolean,"false","false","NA","NA",
01201                                   "Is this method begin called as part of a copynumber run?"};
01202   opts.push_back(copynumber);
01203   SelfDoc::Opt trustcheck = {"TrustCheck",SelfDoc::Opt::Boolean,"false","false","NA","NA",
01204             "Completely untrusted, blimeshed probesets in samples are no-calls"};
01205   opts.push_back(trustcheck);
01206 
01207   return opts;
01208 }
01209 
01210 /**
01211  * @brief Supply a little how/what/why about the algorithms this
01212  * class performs and what parameters it takes.
01213  * @return SelfDoc
01214  */
01215 SelfDoc QuantLabelZ::explainSelf() {
01216   SelfDoc doc;
01217   setupSelfDoc(doc);
01218   return doc;
01219 }
01220 
01221 
01222 /**
01223  * @brief This static function should be overridden by child classes
01224  * to return an object of the correct type initialized correctly
01225  * with the parameters in the string, string map. All objects
01226  * created this way should be deleted when finished using.
01227  *
01228  * @param param - Map of key/value pairs to initialize the object.
01229  *
01230  * @return Pointer toCreate object, this should be sub casted as necessary.
01231  */
01232 SelfCreate *QuantLabelZ::newObject(std::map<std::string,std::string> &param) {
01233   SelfDoc doc = explainSelf();
01234   bool lowprecision = false;
01235   enum Transformation transform = CCS;
01236   double K=4;
01237   string transformStr;
01238   map<string,string>::iterator iter;
01239 
01240   fillInValue(K, "K", param, doc);
01241 
01242   fillInValue(transformStr, "transform", param, doc);
01243   transform = transformationForString(transformStr);
01244   QuantLabelZ *labelz = new QuantLabelZ(transform, K, lowprecision);
01245 
01246   snp_param ts;
01247   ts.Initialize();
01248   // prior strength
01249   fillInValue(ts.prior.aa.k,"KX",param,doc);
01250   ts.prior.bb.k=ts.prior.aa.k;
01251   fillInValue(ts.prior.ab.k,"KH",param,doc);
01252 
01253   fillInValue(ts.prior.ab.v,"V",param,doc);
01254   ts.prior.aa.v=ts.prior.ab.v;
01255   ts.prior.bb.v=ts.prior.ab.v;
01256   // prior centers
01257   fillInValue(ts.prior.bb.m,"BBM",param,doc);
01258   fillInValue(ts.prior.ab.m,"ABM",param,doc);
01259   fillInValue(ts.prior.aa.m,"AAM",param,doc);
01260   // prior y coordinates
01261   fillInValue(ts.prior.bb.ym,"BBY",param,doc);
01262   fillInValue(ts.prior.ab.ym,"ABY",param,doc);
01263   fillInValue(ts.prior.aa.ym,"AAY",param,doc);
01264   // prior variances
01265   fillInValue(ts.prior.aa.ss,"AAV",param,doc);
01266   fillInValue(ts.prior.bb.ss,"BBV",param,doc);
01267   fillInValue(ts.prior.ab.ss,"ABV",param,doc);
01268   // prior y variances
01269   fillInValue(ts.prior.aa.yss,"AAYV",param,doc);
01270   fillInValue(ts.prior.ab.yss,"ABYV",param,doc);
01271   fillInValue(ts.prior.bb.yss,"BBYV",param,doc);
01272   // prior xy covariances
01273   fillInValue(ts.prior.aa.xyss,"AAXY",param,doc);
01274   fillInValue(ts.prior.ab.xyss,"ABXY",param,doc);
01275   fillInValue(ts.prior.bb.xyss,"BBXY",param,doc);
01276   // X-X covariances between clusters
01277    fillInValue(ts.prior.xab,"KXX",param,doc);
01278   fillInValue(ts.prior.xah,"KAH",param,doc);
01279   fillInValue(ts.prior.xhb,"KHB",param,doc);
01280   // Y-Y covariances between clusters
01281   fillInValue(ts.prior.yah,"KYAH",param,doc);
01282   fillInValue(ts.prior.yab,"KYAB",param,doc);
01283   fillInValue(ts.prior.yhb,"KYHB",param,doc);
01284   // wacky parameters
01285   fillInValue(ts.comvar,"COMVAR",param,doc);
01286   fillInValue(ts.hardshell,"HARD",param,doc);
01287   fillInValue(ts.shellbarrier,"SB",param,doc);
01288   fillInValue(ts.callmethod,"CM",param,doc);
01289   fillInValue(ts.bins,"bins",param,doc);
01290   fillInValue(ts.hints,"hints",param,doc);
01291   fillInValue(ts.contradictionpenalty, "CP",param,doc);
01292   fillInValue(ts.hok,"Hok",param,doc);
01293   fillInValue(ts.mix,"mix",param,doc);
01294   fillInValue(ts.bic,"bic",param,doc);
01295   fillInValue(ts.CSepPen,"CSepPen",param,doc);
01296   fillInValue(ts.CSepThr,"CSepThr",param,doc);
01297   fillInValue(ts.lambda,"lambda",param,doc);
01298   fillInValue(ts.wobble,"wobble",param,doc);
01299   fillInValue(ts.copyqc,"copyqc",param,doc);
01300   fillInValue(ts.copytype,"copytype",param,doc);
01301   fillInValue(ts.clustertype,"clustertype",param,doc);
01302   fillInValue(ts.ocean,"ocean",param,doc);
01303   fillInValue(ts.inflatePRA,"inflatePRA",param,doc);
01304   fillInValue(ts.IsoHetY,"IsoHetY",param,doc);
01305   //printf("BBM: %f AAM: %f CM: %d\n",ts.bb.m,ts.aa.m,ts.callmethod);
01306   //ts.aa.Dump();
01307   //ts.ab.Dump();
01308   //ts.bb.Dump();
01309   labelz->setLabelParam(ts);
01310   double t_em_cutoff,t_em_thresh,t_gender_cutoff;
01311   fillInValue(t_em_cutoff,"em_cutoff",param,doc);
01312   fillInValue(t_em_thresh,"em_thresh",param,doc);
01313   fillInValue(t_gender_cutoff,"gender_cutoff",param,doc);
01314   labelz->setGenderParam(t_em_thresh,t_em_cutoff,t_gender_cutoff);
01315   double score;
01316   fillInValue(score,"MS",param,doc);
01317   labelz->setMaxScore(score);
01318   int overrideflag;
01319   fillInValue(overrideflag,"override",param,doc);
01320   labelz->setOverride(overrideflag);
01321   bool bCopyNumber = false;
01322   fillInValue(bCopyNumber,"copynumber",param,doc);
01323   labelz->setCopyNumber(bCopyNumber);
01324   bool trust_check = false;
01325   fillInValue(trust_check,"TrustCheck",param,doc);
01326   labelz->setTrustCheck(trust_check);
01327   return labelz;
01328 }

01340 /**
01341  * Writes normalization functions to a file
01342  *
01343  * @param nMap - normalization functions
01344  * @param fileName - the file to write
01345  */
01346 void QuantLabelZ::writeNormMap(std::vector<NormalizationPredictor> &nMap,
01347                                const std::string& fileName)  {
01348   affx::TsvFile tsv;
01349   //
01350   tsv.defineColumn(0,0,"Sample");
01351   tsv.defineColumn(0,1,"FitBB");
01352   tsv.defineColumn(0,2,"FitAB");
01353   tsv.defineColumn(0,3,"FitAA");
01354   tsv.defineColumn(0,4,"sigma");
01355   tsv.defineColumn(0,5,"Cov");
01356   tsv.defineColumn(0,6,"Targ");
01357   //
01358   tsv.writeTsv_v1(fileName);
01359 
01360   //
01361   for (int i=0;i<nMap.size(); i++) {
01362     //
01363     tsv.set(0,0,i);
01364     // these are all vectors values.
01365     tsv.set(0,1,nMap[i].fitBB);
01366     tsv.set(0,2,nMap[i].fitAB);
01367     tsv.set(0,3,nMap[i].fitAA);
01368     tsv.set(0,4,nMap[i].sigma);
01369     tsv.set(0,5,nMap[i].CenterCovariates);
01370     tsv.set(0,6,nMap[i].TargetCenter);
01371     //
01372     tsv.writeLevel(0);
01373   }
01374   tsv.close();
01375 }

01378 
01379 void QuantLabelZ::writeNormSummaryTsv(const std::string& fileName, 
01380                                       std::vector<std::string> &headers,
01381                                       affx::TsvReport::TsvReportFmt_t format) {
01382   m_NormSummaryTsv.setFilename(fileName);
01383   m_NormSummaryTsv.setFormat(format);
01384   //
01385   // @todo: Is this the best format for the report? -jhg
01386   // we could skip the "Delta" or "Size" by using more columns or seperate reports.
01387   m_NormSummaryTsv.addHeaderComment("minimal file for normalized values");
01388   // the name as a string
01389   m_NormSummaryTsv.defineStringColumn(0,0,"probeset_id",TSVREPORT_PROBESET_STRLEN);
01390   // "Delta" or "Size"
01391   m_NormSummaryTsv.defineStringColumn(0,1,"datatype",TSVREPORT_PROBESET_STRLEN);
01392   // 
01393   m_NormSummaryTsv.defineColumns(Fs::basename(headers),affx::FILE5_DTYPE_DOUBLE,0);
01394   //
01395   m_NormSummaryTsv.writeTsv_v1();
01396 }
01397 
01398 /**
01399  * Writes a summary of the transformed values to a file - i.e as set up for genotyping, not expression
01400  *
01401  * @param m_NormSummaryOut - output stream
01402  * @param m_AValues - first coordinate of transformed data - always "contrast"-like values
01403  * @param m_BValues - second coordinate of transformed data - always "strength"-like values
01404  * @param m_ProbeSetName - what is our SNP?
01405  */
01406 void QuantLabelZ::writeNormSummaryValue(const std::string& m_ProbeSetName,
01407                                         const vector<double>& m_AValues,
01408                                         const vector<double>& m_BValues) {
01409   // delta line first.
01410   m_NormSummaryTsv.set_string(0,0,m_ProbeSetName);
01411   m_NormSummaryTsv.set_string(0,1,"Delta");
01412   for (int i=0; i<m_AValues.size(); i++) {
01413     m_NormSummaryTsv.set_d(0,2+i,m_AValues[i]);
01414   }
01415   m_NormSummaryTsv.writeLevel(0);
01416 
01417   // Then the "Size" line.
01418   m_NormSummaryTsv.set_string(0,0,m_ProbeSetName);
01419   m_NormSummaryTsv.set_string(0,1,"Size");
01420   for (int i=0; i<m_BValues.size(); i++) {
01421     m_NormSummaryTsv.set_d(0,2+i,m_BValues[i]);
01422   }
01423   m_NormSummaryTsv.writeLevel(0);
01424 }

01428 /**
01429  * Write header to the selection file so people don't have to look up everything
01430  *
01431  * @param m_Out - the file for a header
01432  */
01433 void QuantLabelZ::writeSnpProbeTsv(const std::string& fileName,
01434                                    affx::TsvReport::TsvReportFmt_t format) {
01435   //
01436   m_SnpProbeTsv.setFilename(fileName);
01437   m_SnpProbeTsv.setFormat(format);
01438   // write out a header in the file
01439   // describing what we actually are doing
01440   int c=0;
01441   m_SnpProbeTsv.defineStringColumn(0,c++,"ProbeSet",TSVREPORT_PROBESET_STRLEN);
01442   m_SnpProbeTsv.defineColumn(0,c++,"A",affx::FILE5_DTYPE_DOUBLE);
01443   m_SnpProbeTsv.defineColumn(0,c++,"ProbeNum",affx::FILE5_DTYPE_DOUBLE);
01444   m_SnpProbeTsv.defineColumn(0,c++,"ProbeAindex",affx::FILE5_DTYPE_DOUBLE);
01445   m_SnpProbeTsv.defineColumn(0,c++,"ProbeBindex",affx::FILE5_DTYPE_DOUBLE);
01446   m_SnpProbeTsv.defineColumn(0,c++,"HomLogisticCorrect",affx::FILE5_DTYPE_DOUBLE);
01447   m_SnpProbeTsv.defineColumn(0,c++,"HetLogisticCorrect",affx::FILE5_DTYPE_DOUBLE);
01448   m_SnpProbeTsv.defineColumn(0,c++,"LogisticCorrect",affx::FILE5_DTYPE_DOUBLE);
01449   m_SnpProbeTsv.defineColumn(0,c++,"MeanAA",affx::FILE5_DTYPE_DOUBLE);
01450   m_SnpProbeTsv.defineColumn(0,c++,"MeanAB",affx::FILE5_DTYPE_DOUBLE);
01451   m_SnpProbeTsv.defineColumn(0,c++,"MeanBB",affx::FILE5_DTYPE_DOUBLE);
01452   m_SnpProbeTsv.defineColumn(0,c++,"nAA",affx::FILE5_DTYPE_DOUBLE);
01453   m_SnpProbeTsv.defineColumn(0,c++,"nAB",affx::FILE5_DTYPE_DOUBLE);
01454   m_SnpProbeTsv.defineColumn(0,c++,"nBB",affx::FILE5_DTYPE_DOUBLE);
01455   m_SnpProbeTsv.defineColumn(0,c++,"Stdev",affx::FILE5_DTYPE_DOUBLE);
01456   m_SnpProbeTsv.defineColumn(0,c++,"FLDAH",affx::FILE5_DTYPE_DOUBLE);
01457   m_SnpProbeTsv.defineColumn(0,c++,"FLDHB",affx::FILE5_DTYPE_DOUBLE);
01458   m_SnpProbeTsv.defineColumn(0,c++,"FLDAB",affx::FILE5_DTYPE_DOUBLE);
01459   m_SnpProbeTsv.defineColumn(0,c++,"Entropy",affx::FILE5_DTYPE_DOUBLE);
01460   m_SnpProbeTsv.defineColumn(0,c++,"AIC",affx::FILE5_DTYPE_DOUBLE);
01461   m_SnpProbeTsv.defineColumn(0,c++,"B0",affx::FILE5_DTYPE_DOUBLE);
01462   m_SnpProbeTsv.defineColumn(0,c++,"B1",affx::FILE5_DTYPE_DOUBLE);
01463   //
01464   m_SnpProbeTsv.writeTsv_v1();
01465 }
01466 
01467 /**
01468  * Writeprobe writes the summaries to the file
01469  *
01470  * @param m_Out - stream required
01471  * @param probenum - what probe we are
01472  * @param Aid - probe identity for A
01473  * @param Bid - probe identity for B
01474  * @param Summaries - summary information for probe fit
01475  * @param m_Ax - A data (fitted)
01476  * @param m_Bx - B data (fitted - not used)
01477  * @param m_ProbeSetName
01478  */
01479 void QuantLabelZ::writeSnpProbeValue(affx::TsvReport& tsv,
01480                                      int probenum,
01481                                      unsigned int Aid,
01482                                      unsigned int Bid,
01483                                      const vector<double> &Summaries,
01484                                      const vector<double> &m_Ax,
01485                                      const vector<double> &m_Bx,
01486                                      string& m_ProbeSetName) {
01487   // todo add tsvdata here.
01488   int c=0;
01489   tsv.set_string(0,c++,m_ProbeSetName);
01490   tsv.set_string(0,c++,"A"); // This is defined as double above.
01491   tsv.set_d(0,c++,probenum);
01492   tsv.set_d(0,c++,Aid);
01493   tsv.set_d(0,c++,Bid);
01494   //
01495   for (int i=0; i<Summaries.size(); i++) {
01496     tsv.set_d(0,c++,Summaries[i]);
01497   }
01498   for (int i=0;i<m_Ax.size();i++) {
01499     tsv.set_d(0,c++,m_Ax[i]);
01500   }
01501   //
01502   tsv.writeLevel(0);
01503 }

01506 
01507 /// @brief Pick the output version based on the file format.  (txt=>v1,a5=>v2)
01508 void QuantLabelZ::writeSnpPosteriorTsv(const std::string& fileName,
01509                                        affx::TsvReport::TsvReportFmt_t format_file) {
01510   int format_ver = 1;
01511   if (format_file==TsvReport::FMT_TSV) {
01512     format_ver=1;
01513   }
01514   else if (format_file==TsvReport::FMT_A5) {
01515           if (m_bCopyNumber) {
01516       format_ver = 2;
01517     }
01518           else {
01519       format_ver = 3;
01520     }
01521   }
01522   else {
01523     Err::errAbort("writeSnpPosteriorTsv");
01524   }
01525   //
01526   writeSnpPosteriorTsv(fileName,format_file,format_ver);
01527 }
01528 
01529 void QuantLabelZ::writeSnpPosteriorTsv(const std::string& fileName,
01530                                        affx::TsvReport::TsvReportFmt_t format_file,
01531                                        int format_ver) {
01532   // remember the version being written (1 or 2)
01533   m_SnpPosteriorTsv_ver=format_ver;
01534   m_SnpPosteriorName = fileName;
01535   m_PosteriorFormat = format_file;
01536 }
01537 //   //
01538 //     std::vector<std::string>::const_iterator keyIx, paramIx;
01539 //   //
01540 //     Verbose::out(1, "Got " + ToStr(m_Info.m_ParamValues.size()) + " headers to write.");
01541 //   for (keyIx = m_Info.m_ParamNames.begin(), paramIx = m_Info.m_ParamValues.begin();
01542 //       keyIx != m_Info.m_ParamNames.end() && paramIx != m_Info.m_ParamValues.end();
01543 //       ++keyIx, ++paramIx) {
01544 //     // @todo should we using the AffymetrixParameterConsts.h #defined values?

01556 /**
01557  *  Writes one specific posterior to a file along with snp name
01558  *
01559  * @param tsp - snp specific parameters, including posterior distribution of cluster centers
01560  * @param out - output stream

01562  * @param fieldDelim - always tab

01566                                          snp_param &tsp) {

01568                                       probeset_id,tsp);

01577 
01578 void QuantLabelZ::setParameters(PsBoard &board) {
01579   Options *o = board.getOptions();
01580   vector<string> celFiles = o->getOptVector("cels");
01581   string outDir = o->getOpt("out-dir");
01582   if (o->getOpt("read-models-brlmmp") != "") {
01583       if (!o->getOptBool("brlmmp-models-non-sequential")) {
01584           m_SequentialModelFile = o->getOpt("read-models-brlmmp");
01585           m_SequentialModelTsv.open(m_SequentialModelFile);
01586           m_SequentialModelTsv.bind(0,"id", &m_Id, affx::TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
01587           m_SequentialModelTsv.bind(0,"BB", &m_BB, affx::TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
01588           m_SequentialModelTsv.bind(0,"AB", &m_AB, affx::TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
01589           m_SequentialModelTsv.bind(0,"AA", &m_AA, affx::TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
01590           
01591           int fc_cidx =  m_SequentialModelTsv.cname2cidx(0,"CV");
01592           if (fc_cidx!=affx::TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND) {
01593               m_SequentialModelTsv.bind(0, "CV", &m_CV, affx::TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
01594           }
01595           else {
01596               m_CV = "0,0,0";
01597           }
01598           
01599       }
01600       else {
01601           readSnpPriorMap(o->getOpt("read-models-brlmmp"));
01602       }
01603   }
01604   
01605   // @todo refactor - put current analysis path name on bboard
01606   string outfile = Fs::join(outDir,getType() + ".snp-posteriors");
01607   bool writeModels = o->getOptBool("write-models");
01608   if (writeModels) {
01609     writeSnpPosteriorTsv(outfile,affx::TsvReport::FMT_TSV);
01610     string modelFile = outfile + ".txt";
01611     board.set("model-file-written", modelFile);
01612   }
01613   // @todo refactor - put current analysis path name on bboard
01614   outfile =Fs::join(outDir,getType() + ".normalized-summary");
01615   if (o->getOptBool("summaries")) {
01616     writeNormSummaryTsv(outfile, celFiles,affx::TsvReport::FMT_TSV);
01617   }
01618   if (o->getOptBool("select-probes")) {
01619     // @todo refactor - put current analysis path name on bboard
01620     outfile =Fs::join(outDir,getType() + ".select-probes");
01621     writeSnpProbeTsv(outfile,affx::TsvReport::FMT_TSV);
01622   }
01623 
01624   // Add quantification method.
01625   QuantMethodFactory qFactory;
01626   string qMethodSpec = o->getOpt("qmethod-spec");
01627   QuantMethod *qMethod = qFactory.quantMethodForString(qMethodSpec, board);
01628   QuantExprMethod *eMethod = NULL;
01629   eMethod= static_cast<QuantExprMethod *>(qMethod);
01630   if (eMethod == NULL) {
01631     Err::errAbort("Couldn't make a QuantExprMethod for specification: " + qMethodSpec);
01632   }
01633   setQuantExprMethod(eMethod);
01634   
01635   GenotypeInfo *gInfo = board.getGenotypeInfo();
01636   if (gInfo == NULL) {
01637     Err::errAbort("QuantLabelZ::setParameters() - GenotypeInfo is NULL");
01638   }
01639   if (!gInfo->m_SpecialSnps->empty())
01640     setSpecialSnps(*(gInfo->m_SpecialSnps));
01641   if (!gInfo->m_HaploidSnps->empty())
01642     setHaploidSnps(*(gInfo->m_HaploidSnps));
01643   setGenders(gInfo->m_Genders->getGenders());
01644   // add sample covariate inbreeding penalty here
01645   // this is highly indirect at this point, but perhaps there's a general model for sample covariates
01646   setInbredHetPenalty(gInfo->m_Inbred->getInbredStatus());
01647   if (o->isOptDefined("output-probabilities")) {
01648     m_OutputProbabilities = (o->getOpt("output-probabilities")!="");
01649   }
01650   try {
01651     board.get(ArtifactReduction::getProbesetTrustFileKey(), &m_ProbeSetTrustTmpFileName);
01652   }
01653   catch(...) {
01654     // HACK: board.get takes abortOnError as a parameter but that parameter is ignored. 
01655     // just ignore it.
01656   }
01657   
01658 }
